eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Men and women between the ages of 50 and 85 years
* Macular status ranges from large drusen in both eyes or large drusen in one eye and advanced AMD (neovascular AMD or geographic atrophy) in the fellow eye

Exclusion Criteria:

* Ocular media not clear enough to allow good fundus photography

outcomeMeasures.title: Development of Advanced AMD in People at Moderate to High Risk for Progression.
outcomeMeasures.description: Defined as central geographic atrophy or retinal features of choroidal neovascularization detected on central grading of the stereoscopic fundus photographs or a history of treatment for advanced AMD after study enrollment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression to Moderate Vision Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Loss defined as \>/= 3 lines of letters from baseline or treatment for choroidal neovascularization

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: Safety outcomes included serious adverse events and mortality.

outcomeMeasures.title: Progression to Cataract Surgery
outcomeMeasures.description: The study examined the effects of lutein/zeaxanthin on progression to cataract surgery with data collected during regular telephone contacts and the annual study visits.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incident Cardiovascular Disease
outcomeMeasures.description: Effects of oral supplementation of omega-3 fatty acids, lutein/zeaxanthin on cardiovascular disease

outcomeMeasures.title: Cognition as Measured by a Telephone Battery
outcomeMeasures.description: Effects of oral supplementation of omega-3 fatty acids, lutein/zeaxanthin, zinc, and beta-carotene on cognitive function

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Peripheral Changes as Measured Using OPTOS Imaging
outcomeMeasures.description: Effects of oral supplementation of omega-3 fatty acids, lutein/zeaxanthin on the peripheral retina

outcomeMeasures.title: Genetics for the Association of AMD and Cataract
Genetics for the Progression of AMD and Cataract
